    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static CameraHandle getInstance()
        The default instance of the CameraHandle
        Returns:
        the default instance of the CameraHandle

      • openCamera

        public void openCamera(android.hardware.camera2.CameraManager manager,
                       CameraCharacterizer.CameraType cameraType)
                throws android.hardware.camera2.CameraAccessException,
                       java.lang.SecurityException
        Attempts to open and connect to the system's camera device
        Parameters:
        manager - the system's CameraManager
        cameraType - a CameraCharacterizer constant denoting the desired type of camera (Front or Back)
        Throws:
        android.hardware.camera2.CameraAccessException - thrown if there was an error with opening the camera device
        java.lang.SecurityException - user has not granted permissions for the camera

      • getCameraConnected

        public boolean getCameraConnected()
        Check if the camera has been opened and is connected
        Returns:
        true if the camera device is opened otherwise false

      • startFeed

        public void startFeed(android.view.Surface... recordSurfaces)
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      android.hardware.camera2.CameraAccessException
        Begins an active camera feed that draws frames to the specified surfaces
        Parameters:
        recordSurfaces - a list of surfaces to draw the camera frames to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the camera has not yet been opened
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there was an error when accessing the camera device
        android.hardware.camera2.CameraAccessException - if there was an error when attempting to communicate with the camera device

      • getSupportedResolution

        public android.util.Size getSupportedResolution(android.util.Size minimumRes)
        Gets the minmum resolution supported by the camera that is greater than a specified minimum
        Parameters:
        minimumRes - the minimum resolution size to be considered
        Returns:
        the optimal resolution supported by the camera that is >= the minimumRes

      • captureImage

        public void captureImage(boolean useFlash)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                         android.hardware.camera2.CameraAccessException
        Begins an image capture from the current camera feed. The resulting image is returned by the CameraStatusListener
        Parameters:
        useFlash - if true then enables flash for the image capture. Otherwise flash is disabled
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - thrown when the camera feed has not been started. Also thrown if a CameraStatusListener has not been registered for the CameraHandle
        android.hardware.camera2.CameraAccessException - thrown if there was an error with opening the camera device

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops any current camera feeds and releases the camera device and capture session

      • setCameraStatusListener

        public void setCameraStatusListener(CameraHandle.CameraStatusCallback cameraStatus)
        Registers a callback listner to get the status of the camera
        Parameters:
        cameraStatus - a callback listner to get the status of the camera
